part.title: This is a k8sconsole api docs

partintro.simpara: K8sconsole is a web console designed to manage kubernetes resources, just like the command-line tool kubectl.
We can use apis list below to get/post/delete kubernetes resources.

section.title: Version information
section.simpara: Version : v0.0.1

section.title: Contact information
section.simpara: Contact Email : wzt3309@gmail.com

section.title: URI scheme
section.simpara: Host : localhost:9090 BasePath : /api/v1 Schemes : HTTP, HTTPS

listitem.simpara: persistent-volume : CRUD Operations of Persistent Volume
persistent-volume-claim : CRUD Operations of Persistent Volume Claim

entry.simpara:
The 'filterBy' takes raw filter options string like param1=val1,param2=val2.
The valid filter parameters like below(configmap.ObjectMeta is in k8s.io/api/core/v1/types.go): * name - configmap.ObjectMeta.name * creationTimestamp - configmap.ObjectMeta.creationTimestamp * namespace - configmap.ObjectMeta.namespace
And we use full match to filter value, just like syntax of 'like' in mysql
e.g.
'/configmap?filterBy=name,kube-' will filter all pods which ObjectMeta.name contains string 'kube-'
The number of items per page
The page number, which must starts from '1'

The 'sortBy' holds the name of property that should be sorted and whether order should be asc or desc.
Like 'd,param1' means sort by param1 in desc. The valid sort parameters are same as 'filterBy'
e.g.
'/configmap?sortBy=d,name'

The 'filterBy' takes raw filter options string like param1=val1,param2=val2.
The valid filter parameters like below(configmap.ObjectMeta is in k8s.io/api/core/v1/types.go): * name - configmap.ObjectMeta.name * creationTimestamp - configmap.ObjectMeta.creationTimestamp * namespace - configmap.ObjectMeta.namespace
And we use full match to filter value, just like syntax of 'like' in mysql
e.g.
'/configmap/{namespace}?filterBy=name,kube-' will filter all pods which ObjectMeta.name contains string 'kube-'
The number of items per page
The page number, which must starts from '1'

The 'sortBy' holds the name of property that should be sorted and whether order should be asc or desc.
Like 'd,param1' means sort by param1 in desc. The valid sort parameters are same as 'filterBy'
e.g.
'/configmap/{namespace}?sortBy=d,name'

section.title: Description
section.simpara: Note. csrf has not be enable yet. So you can just test this api, but is meaningless.

entry.simpara: Different verb, e.g. if action is 'put' means to get csrftoken for verb post Posible value of path parameter - action: * PUT * POST * GET * DELETE

section.title: Description
section.simpara: We hava three authentication modes: * basic - use username and password, and k8s apiserver need support ABAC mode * token(recommand) - use k8s secret token for a service account * kubeconfig - not support yet

entry.simpara: LoginSpec contains information required to authenticate user.

section.title: A flag of hide 'auth skip' button
Description
section.simpara: LoginSkippableResponse contains a flag that tells the frontend not to display the 'auth skip' button It’s just for hide the button, not disable unauthenticated access

entry.simpara: NamespaceSpec is a specification of namespace to create

The 'filterBy' takes raw filter options string like param1=val1,param2=val2.
The valid filter parameters like below(namespace.ObjectMeta is in k8s.io/api/core/v1/types.go): * name - namespace.ObjectMeta.name * creationTimestamp - namespace.ObjectMeta.creationTimestamp * namespace - namespace.ObjectMeta.namespace
And we use full match to filter value, just like syntax of 'like' in mysql
e.g.
'/namespace?filterBy=name,kube-' will filter all pods which ObjectMeta.name contains string 'kube-'
The number of items per page
The page number, which must starts from '1'

The 'sortBy' holds the name of property that should be sorted and whether order should be asc or desc.
Like 'd,param1' means sort by param1 in desc. The valid sort parameters are same as 'filterBy'
e.g.
'/namespace?sortBy=d,name'

section.title: Get all events of the namespace

The 'filterBy' takes raw filter options string like param1=val1,param2=val2.

And we use full match to filter value, just like syntax of 'like' in mysql
e.g.

The 'sortBy' holds the name of property that should be sorted and whether order should be asc or desc.

And we use full match to filter value, just like syntax of 'like' in mysql
e.g.

The number of items per page
The page number, which must starts from '1'

The 'sortBy' holds the name of property that should be sorted and whether order should be asc or desc.
Like 'd,param1' means sort by param1 in desc. The valid sort parameters are same as 'filterBy'
e.g.

section.title: Get persistent volume list of the storageclass
Description
section.simpara: Refresh jweToken avoiding which was expired.

entry.simpara: TokenRefreshSpec contains token that is required by token refresh operation.

section.title: AuthResponse
section.simpara: AuthResponse represents the response returned from k8sconsole backend for login requests. It contains generated jweToken and a list of non-critical errors such as 'Failed authentication' to tell the frontend what unexpected happened during login request.

section.title: Condition
section.simpara: Condition represents a single condition of a node or pod. e.g. v1.Pod.Status.Condition

entry.simpara: Last probe time of a condition
Last transition time of a condition

section.title: ConfigMap
section.simpara: ConfigMap API resource provides mechanisms to inject containers with configuration data while keeping containers agnostic of Kubernetes

section.title: ConfigMapDetail
section.simpara: ConfigMapDetail API resource provides mechanisms to inject containers with configuration data while keeping containers agnostic of Kubernetes

entry.simpara: Data contains the configuration data. Each key must be a valid DNS_SUBDOMAIN with an optional leading dot.

section.title: ConfigMapList
section.simpara: ConfigMapList contains a list of Config Maps in the cluster

entry.simpara: Time at which the container was last (re-)started

section.title: ContainerStateTerminated
section.simpara: ContainerStateTerminated is a terminated state of a container

entry.simpara: Exit status from the last termination of the container
Time at which the container last terminated
Message regarding the last termination of the container
(brief) Reason from the last termination of the container
Signal from the last termination of the container
Time at which previous execution of the container started

section.title: ContainerStateWaiting
section.simpara: ContainerStateWaiting is a waiting state of a container

entry.simpara: Message regarding why the container is not yet running
(brief) Reason the container is not yet running

section.title: Endpoint
section.simpara: Endpoint describes an endpoint that is host and a list of available ports for that host

entry.simpara: Hostname, either as a domain name or IP address

section.title: Event
section.simpara: Event of k8s

entry.simpara: The number of times this event has occurred
The time at which the event was first occurred
The time at which the event was last occurred
A human-readable description of the status of related object
Short, machine-understandable string that gives the reason for this event being generated
Component from which the event is generated
Host name on which the event is generated

section.title: EventList
section.simpara: The list of k8s events

section.title: JWE
section.simpara: JWE is the body of jweToken is a token generated during login request that contains auth info data in the payload. We don’t need to care about the content of jweToken in the frontend or client.
When we use other api, we need to put the jweToken in the request http header otherwise we will be returned code 403.
Note. we don’t have to use jweToken auth in the dev version(v0.0.1) to get resources.

entry.simpara: Default resource requirement limit value by resource name.
DefaultRequest resource requirement request value by resource name
Max usage constraints on this kind by resource name
MaxLimitRequestRatio represents the max burst value for the named resource
Min usage constraints on this kind by resource name
ResourceName usage constraints on this kind by resource name
ResourceType of resource that this limit applies to

section.title: ListMeta
section.simpara: ListMeta describes list of objects.

entry.simpara: Total number of items in list

section.title: LoginSpec
section.simpara: LoginSpec is extracted from request coming from k8sconsole frontend during loging request. It contains all information required to authenticate user.

entry.simpara: KubeConfig is the content of users' kubeconfig file. We can extract all auth information from the data in the file.
Use basic mode, need with username.
Can use kubectl describe secret …​ get the token for the default service account. Example : "test-token"
Use basic mode, need with password.

section.title: NamespaceDetail
section.simpara: NamespaceDetail is a presentation layer view of Kubernetes Namespace resource. This means it is Namespace plus additional augmented data we can get from other sources.

entry.simpara: ResourceLimits is list of limit ranges associated to the namespace

section.title: Node
section.simpara: Node is a presentation layer view of kubernetes nodes

entry.simpara: These are valid condition statuses. "True" means a resource is in the condition. "False" means a resource is not in the condition. "Unknown" means kubernetes can’t decide if a resource is in the condition or not.

section.title: NodeAddress
section.simpara: NodeAddress contains information for the node’s address

section.title: NodeAllocatedResources
section.simpara: NodeAllocatedResources describes node allocated resources

entry.simpara: AllocatedPods in number of currently allocated pods on the node
CPUCapacity is specified node CPU capacity in millicores
CPULimitsFraction is a fraction of defined CPU limit. Note. can be over 100%, i.e. overcommitted.
CPURequestsFraction is a fraction of CPU, that is allocated

Kubernetes has a new metric called Millicores that is used to measure CPU usage. It is a CPU core split into 1000 units (milli = 1000). - 1. 1 cpu with 1 core has 1000m - 2. 1 cpu with 2 core has 2*1000m = 2000m
CPURequests is number of allocated millicores
MemoryCapacity is specified node memory capacity in bytes
MemoryLimitsFraction is a fraction of defined memory limit, can be over 100%, i.e. overcommitted
MemoryRequests is a fraction of memory, that is allocated
MemoryRequestsFraction is a fraction of memory, that is allocated
PodCapacity is maximum number of pods, that can be allocated on the node
PodFraction is a fraction of pods, that can be allocated on given node

section.title: NodeDetail
section.simpara: NodeDetail is a presentation layer view of Kubernetes Node resource. This means it is Node plus additional augmented data we can get from other sources.

entry.simpara: The three valid phases of node: * Pending - the node has been created/added by the system, but not configured * Running - the node has been configured and has Kubernetes components running * Terminated - the node has been removed from the cluster
PodCIDR represents the pod IP range assigned to the node
ID of the node assigned by the cloud provider
The node this Taint is attached to has the "effect" on any pod that does not tolerate the Taint
Unschedulable controls node schedulability of new pods. By default node is schedulable
The Architecture reported by the node
Boot ID reported by the node
ContainerRuntime Version reported by the node through runtime remote API (e.g. docker://1.5.0)
Kernel Version reported by the node from 'uname -r' (e.g. 3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64)
KubeProxy Version reported by the node
Kubelet Version reported by the node
MachineID reported by the node. For unique machine identification in the cluster this field is preferred. Learn more from man(5) machine-id: http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/machine-id.5.html
The Operating System reported by the node
OS Image reported by the node from /etc/os-release (e.g. Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy))

SystemUUID reported by the node. For unique machine identification MachineID is preferred. This field is specific to Red Hat hosts https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Subscription_Management/1/html/RHSM/getting-system-uuid.html
The effect of the taint on pods that do not tolerate the taint. Valid effects are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.
The taint key to be applied to a node
TimeAdded represents the time at which the taint was added. It is only written for NoExecute taints
The taint value corresponding to the taint key

section.title: NodeList
section.simpara: NodeList contains a list of nodes in the cluster

section.title: ObjectMeta
section.simpara: ObjectMeta is metadata about an instance of resource

entry.simpara: Annotations are unstructured key value data stored with a resource that be set by external tooling.
Labels are k-v pairs that may be scope and select individual resources.
Object name and the name is unique within a namespace
Any empty namespace equivalent to the 'default' namespace. Not all objects are required to be scoped to a namespace - the value of this field for those objects will be empty

section.title: PersistentVolume
section.simpara: PersistentVolume provides the simplified presentation layer view of kubernetes Persistent Volume resource.

entry.simpara: d is the quantity in inf.Dec form if d.Dec != nil
Change Format at will. See the comment for Canonicalize for more details.
i is the quantity in int64 scaled form, if d.Dec == nil
s is the generated value of this quantity to avoid recalculation
Scale represents the type used for the scale of a Dec.
An Int represents a signed multi-precision integer. The zero value for an Int represents the value 0.

Scale is used for getting and setting the base-10 scaled value.
Base-2 scales are omitted for mathematical simplicity.
See Quantity.ScaledValue for more details.

section.title: PersistentVolumeClaim
section.simpara: PersistentVolumeClaim provides the simplified presentation layer view of Kubernetes Persistent Volume Claim resource.

entry.simpara: d is the quantity in inf.Dec form if d.Dec != nil
Change Format at will. See the comment for Canonicalize for more details.
i is the quantity in int64 scaled form, if d.Dec == nil
s is the generated value of this quantity to avoid recalculation
Scale represents the type used for the scale of a Dec.
An Int represents a signed multi-precision integer. The zero value for an Int represents the value 0.

Scale is used for getting and setting the base-10 scaled value.
Base-2 scales are omitted for mathematical simplicity.
See Quantity.ScaledValue for more details.

section.title: PersistentVolumeClaimDetail
section.simpara: PersistentVolumeClaimDetail provides the presentation layer view of Kubernetes Persistent Volume Claim resource.

entry.simpara: d is the quantity in inf.Dec form if d.Dec != nil
Change Format at will. See the comment for Canonicalize for more details.
i is the quantity in int64 scaled form, if d.Dec == nil
s is the generated value of this quantity to avoid recalculation
Scale represents the type used for the scale of a Dec.
An Int represents a signed multi-precision integer. The zero value for an Int represents the value 0.

Scale is used for getting and setting the base-10 scaled value.
Base-2 scales are omitted for mathematical simplicity.
See Quantity.ScaledValue for more details.

section.title: PersistentVolumeClaimList
section.simpara: PersistentVolumeClaimList contains a list of Persistent Volume Claims in the cluster.

section.title: PersistentVolumeDetail
section.simpara: PersistentVolumeDetail provides the presentation layer view of kubernetes Persistent Volume resource.

entry.simpara:
PersistentVolumeSource is similar to VolumeSource but meant for the administrator who creates PVs. Exactly one of its members must be set.
See k8s.io/api/core/v1/types.go
d is the quantity in inf.Dec form if d.Dec != nil
Change Format at will. See the comment for Canonicalize for more details.
i is the quantity in int64 scaled form, if d.Dec == nil
s is the generated value of this quantity to avoid recalculation
Scale represents the type used for the scale of a Dec.
An Int represents a signed multi-precision integer. The zero value for an Int represents the value 0.

Scale is used for getting and setting the base-10 scaled value.
Base-2 scales are omitted for mathematical simplicity.
See Quantity.ScaledValue for more details.

section.title: PersistentVolumeList
section.simpara: PersistentVolumeList contains a list of Persistent Volumes in the cluster

section.title: Pod
section.simpara: Pod is a view of kubernetes Pod resource, it is Pod plus additional augmented data

entry.simpara: Name of the node this pod runs on
Running Pending Failed Succeeded in apiserver guess

section.title: ResourceQuotaDetailList
section.simpara: ResourceQuotaList is list of resource quotas associated to the namespace

section.title: ResourceStatus
section.simpara: ResourceStatus provides basic information about resource status on the list

entry.simpara: Number of resources that are currently in failed state
Number of resources that are currently in pending state
Number of resources that are currently in running state
Number of resources that are currently in succeeded state

section.title: Secret
section.simpara: Secret is a single secret returned to the frontend

entry.simpara: enum (Opaque, kubernetes.io/service-account-token, kubernetes.io/service-account.name, kubernetes.io/service-account.uid, token, kubernetes.kubeconfig, ca.crt, namespace, kubernetes.io/dockercfg, .dockercfg, kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson, .dockerconfigjson, kubernetes.io/basic-auth, username, password, kubernetes.io/ssh-auth, ssh-privatekey, kubernetes.io/tls, tls.crt, tls.key)

section.title: SecretDetail
section.simpara: SecretDetail API resource provides mechanisms to inject containers with configuration data while keeping containers agnostic of Kubernetes

entry.simpara:
Data contains the secret data. Each key must be a valid DNS_SUBDOMAIN or leading dot followed by valid DNS_SUBDOMAIN.
The serialized form of the secret data is a base64 encoded string, representing the arbitrary (possibly non-string) data value here.

enum (Opaque, kubernetes.io/service-account-token, kubernetes.io/service-account.name, kubernetes.io/service-account.uid, token, kubernetes.kubeconfig, ca.crt, namespace, kubernetes.io/dockercfg, .dockercfg, kubernetes.io/dockerconfigjson, .dockerconfigjson, kubernetes.io/basic-auth, username, password, kubernetes.io/ssh-auth, ssh-privatekey, kubernetes.io/tls, tls.crt, tls.key)

section.title: SecretList
section.simpara: SecretsList is a response structure for a queried secrets list

section.title: Service
section.simpara: SecretDetail API resource provides mechanisms to inject containers with configuration data while keeping containers agnostic of Kubernetes

entry.simpara: ClusterIP is usually assigned by the master. Valid values: - None (can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required) - empty string ("") - valid IP address
Service Type string describes ingress methods for a service

section.title: ServiceDetail
section.simpara: Detail of service

entry.simpara: ClusterIP is usually assigned by the master. Valid values: - None (can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required) - empty string ("") - valid IP address
Service Type string describes ingress methods for a service

section.title: ServiceList
section.simpara: ServiceList contains a list of services in the cluster

section.title: ServicePort
section.simpara: ServicePort is a pair of port and protocol - service endpoint

entry.simpara: The port on each node on which the service is exposed
Protocol defines network protocols supported for things like container ports

section.title: StorageClass
section.simpara: SecretDetail API resource provides mechanisms to inject containers with configuration data while keeping containers agnostic of Kubernetes

entry.simpara: Parameters holds parameters for the provisioner
Provisioner is the driver expected to handle this StorageClass. For example: "kubernetes.io/gce-pd" or "kubernetes.io/aws-ebs". This value may not be empty

section.title: StorageClassList
section.simpara: StorageClassList contains a list of StorageClass in the cluster.

section.title: TypeMeta
section.simpara: TypeMeta describes the type of an object in response and request
